title: Failure to Handle Missing Parameter
overview: If too few arguments are sent to a function, the function will still pop the expected number of arguments from the stack. Potentially, a variable number of arguments could be exhausted in a function as well.
remediation: ::PHASE:Build and Compilation:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:This issue can be simply combated with the use of proper build process.::PHASE:Implementation:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Forward declare all functions. This is the recommended solution. Properly forward declaration of all used functions will result in a compiler error if too few arguments are sent to a function.::
